sentences.en: Enemies and lovers are destined to meet.
Everyone knew that Muriel was destined for great things.
sentences.cn: 所有人都知道缪里尔命中注定要成就一番伟业。

sentences.en: He feels that he was destined to become a musician.
sentences.cn: 他觉得自己注定会成为一名音乐家。

sentences.en: He was destined for a career in the Bank of England.
sentences.cn: 他注定要在英格兰银行开始职业生涯。

sentences.en: He was destined from his birth to enter into the church.
sentences.cn: 他生来就注定要当牧师。

sentences.en: He was somehow destined to become a rock messiah.
sentences.cn: 冥冥之中，他注定会成为摇滚乐的救世主。

sentences.en: It was destined that they would marry.
London seems destined to lose more than 2,000 hospital beds.
sentences.cn: 伦敦似乎一定会丧失2,000多个医院床位。
医学是她命中注定要从事的职业.
医学是他注定要从事的职业.

sentences.en: The film is destined to become a cult classic.
sentences.cn: 这部电影注定会成为风靡一时的经典之作。

sentences.en: The flight was destined for Cairo.
They were destined never to see each other again.
sentences.cn: 他们命中注定再也不能相见.

sentences.en: This is a train destined for London.
sentences.cn: 这是一列开往伦敦的火车.

sentences.en: Those books were destined for her.
Those born to the purple are destined to live in the public eye.
sentences.cn: 那些出身贵族的人们的一言一行势必要受到公众的注意.

trans.tran_cn: 注定的，一定的，去往（某地）的
trans.tran_en: seeming certain to happen at some time in the future

trans.tran_cn: 注定（destine的过去式和过去分词）
